content:
Dissatisfied with your large Mastodon instance? Consider migrating to #AllThingsTech.

Here‚Äôs how w/o losing followers:

1. Go to your OLD server. Go to preferences, import/export lists
2. Sign up @ https://allthingstech.social
3. On ALLTHINGSTECH.SOCIAL server: Go to Account -> Moving FROM another account
4. Enter old account's handle
5. On OLD server: Go to Account -> Moving TO another account
6. Enter new account's handle and submit
7. Import lists on new server

#Mastodon #MastodonMigration

Can we make the 1st and 15th of every month "Bimonthly Obligatory Twitter Shitposting" Days? #TwitterMigration #MastodonMigration #Birdsite

"Twitter's official policy now considers a user inactive if they fail to log in "at least every 30 days." An archived version of this policy shows that as recently as April 19, the policy had been to log in every six months to keep an account active. Twitter seems to have quietly updated the policy within the past few weeks."

content:
Want to find your own toots in a sea of boosts? Or let others do the same? There's a tool for that! üòé

https://justmytoots.com/

By @cookie_mumbles

Just put your full username at the end of the URL, like this:

https://justmytoots.com/@5ciFiGirl@starbase80.wtf

It is entirely opt-in, so it won't work until you put that URL somewhere in your bio!

(Make sure it is a full clickable URL, with --https://-- and --.com-- üòâ)

1/2

#JustMyToots

#FediTips #Mastodon #MastodonMigration

content:
Growing pains...

Months in now to the great #MastodonMigration, and our community is being tested. Mastodon is not perfect. The interface needs polish, the feature set is a source of contention, and shiny new objects hold out promises to solve everything that frustrates us. But for all that, it is an amazing phenomenon. A rag-tag, people powered network threatens corporate domination of social networking. Together we can do this.

1/8
#twittermigration #BIPOC #BlackMastodon #LGBTQIA

content:
For anyone asking, here are a few changes Eugen did on mastodon.online:

1. Now, when you search people in Mastodon's nightly build, you will notice if a person official, because if they is, then you will see a verified link right under person's profile without even visiting it. Checkout the screenshot below when I searched "eugen".

2. You'll probably notice that on your right panel, "Direct Messages" has been renamed to "Private mentions".

3. You'll probably will not notice it so much, but now you have a new setting called "Discovery" which allows you to change: do you want to see trends or not.

Also, @mastodonmigration had said that there's a good rendering of threads, but I tried my best on searching for threads on mastodon.online and on my side, it actually doesn't dispaly as the thread I would expect. Idk.

#Mastodon #MastodonMigration

content:
Well, I did it. I pulled the plug on Twitter.

An eerie wind is howling around the house; the bird calls have taken on a keening urgency; the freight trains are rattling by rather than rumbling in the distance. But I'm sure it's nothing.

üò±

content:
@davidfolkenflik writing on NPR:

> NPR will no longer post fresh content to its 52 official Twitter feeds, becoming the first major news organization to go silent on the social media platform.

> By going silent on Twitter, NPR's chief executive says the network is protecting its credibility and its ability to produce journalism without "a shadow of negativity."

> "The downside, whatever the downside, doesn't change that fact," NPR CEO John Lansing said in an interview. "I would never have our content go anywhere that would risk our credibility."

https://www.npr.org/2023/04/12/1169269161/npr-leaves-twitter-government-funded-media-label

People new to #mastodon & the #Fediverse if you want a cool feed understanding that your federated feed is ONLY those accounts on your instance and those on other instances they follow NOT the entire fediverse is key.
So follow lots of people, especially from other instances, go to their profiles find others there from other instances and follow them, so you are not trapped in a local instance bubble

content:
Don't celebrate Mastodon racing #10million users just yet, as there was a recent beta of #Calckey which shows up as #Mastodon to this user count script, with the side effect that it's been over counting for a few days.

Apparently the dev version has already been patched and once the update rolls out these servers should stop showing up as Mastodon instances to the user count script.

We will reach 10 million users (and more), but we haven't already!

#TwitterMigration #MastodonMigration #FediTips

content:
How to install the built-in Mastodon Progress Web App on your #Windows computer. PUSH notifications work and other "app-like" features.

1. On your computer, open Chrome or Edge.

2. Go to your #Mastodon instance you want to install.

3. At the top right of the address bar, click Install. (Circled in red)

4. Follow the onscreen instructions to install the PWA. (Circled in blue)

#TwitterMigration #MastodonMigration

#Feditips #Windows10 #Windows11

content:
People move from the üê§ site and complain they're not getting engagement on here.

It's because you're treating it like the üê§ site.

Follow people you find interesting, use hashtags to draw people interested in your topic into a conversation, and converse with others on their posts. Boost posts you find interesting, favorite things you like, and remember you're surrounded by fellow humans, unchained from a damned algorithm.
#twitterdown #MastodonMigration #algorithm #BirdSite #fediTips

content:
@gedeonm Yes! This.

Have watched as new arrivals join us in past months and those that complain about poor engagement invariably haven't taken the key step of following people.

Gotta go a bit click-happy and add about 100‚Äì200. You can quickly drop any aloof or uninteresting people later. But the engagement gets good, and richer than the birdsite.

And *yes* to hashtags, but keep them relevant.

#mastodonMigration #MastoEtiquette #potatoChips

@amy_ryloth Ah! That's probably why you don't see much interaction. Unlike Twitter, you aren't penalised for using hashtags. In fact, they're pretty much essential for people to communicate with others about any topic.

https://lgbtqia.space - LGBTQ+ folks
https://toot.lgbt - women & all LGBTQ+ folks
https://neurodifferent.me - neurodivergent folks

#MastodonMigration

#MastodonMigration was the right move.

content:
#MastodonMigration caveats 2/
30 day cooldown applies only to the old acct: as in moving followers multiple times from the original server. Unlikely?

You can quickly move again from the *new* server. I'd wait for all followers to arrive first.
https://eldritch.cafe/@yonabee/109906208870346342

Two oft-conflated terms:
* Redirect‚ÄîLocks the old account & says on your profile where you went.
* Move‚ÄîDoes a redirect *and* gradually transfers followers (has cooldown).
https://docs.joinmastodon.org/user/moving/

Btw lock toggle credit: @adamcr

#FediTips #MastodonMigration #Migration #Fediverse

content:
Sneaky way to pull over stuff that you've liked and reposted, when moving instances:

Every time you like/repost, also bookmark it.

Periodically download your bookmarks file (or just let the list get huge.)

When you need to migrate, export/import your bookmarks.

Slowly repost your bookmarked posts. (Say, 5-10 per day, scattered about or during "off" hours.)

Won't capture your original content (you can download that.) But it's better than nothing.

#MastodonMigration #FediTips

Sorry for the post spam, by the by.

One key design flaw of Mastodon is that you cannot copy across posts from one instance to another when you migrate servers.

As such, I'm having to manually repost certain posts, so that they're not lost to the void when Mastodon.lol shuts down forever.

#MastodonLOL #ServerMigration #InstanceMigration #MastodonMigration

content:
#MastodonMigration
Export stuff. Create a new acct, set prefs, import. Boost old posts? Do final profile/post edits. Profile redirect locks the old acct (toggle later to unlock). Move takes days. As followers move, their lists will lose your acct.

Posts export. Won't import.
Lists export. Won't import. Workaround at the link.
https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/issues/15015
Profile notes won't export.
https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/issues/19959
Nor filters.
https://old.reddit.com/r/Mastodon/comments/10g6cnq/is_there_a_way_to_importexport_filters/

Adv tools can dump/view old data.
https://github.com/kensanata/mastodon-archive

filtered_content: export stuff create new acct set import boost old posts final profile post edits profile redirect locks old acct toggle later takes days followers lists lose acct posts export import lists export import workaround link profile notes export filters tools view old data

content: Lately, all of my social media posts are feeling like lessons in impermanence. My tweets are gone, my Facebook posts are gone, my Instagram posts are gone, and now my mastodon.lol posts are gone. In many ways, that's okay. It's a good reminder that thoughts and notes housed on an outside server are not truly and entirely my own‚Äîthey're just renting space. Perhaps years from now, I'll think of them as cringe and be glad they're gone. Right now, though, I miss them a bit. #Migration #MastodonMigration #impermanence

content:
New to Mastodon? Here's a good tip when you post something.

Include an image description, often referred to as ALT TEXT.

Accessibility is a huge thing here on Mastodon that everyone should be thoughtful and respectful of.

Including ALT TEXT allows those with certain impairments to know what your image is about that you're including within your post.

#NewHere #MastodonMigration #Mastodon #TwitterMigration #FediTips #MastodonTips #Tips

Hello!

Since I'm on a new instance, I figured it's time for a new #introduction toot!

My name is Ten. Yes, that's my name!

You'll probably see me toot out various silly puns and jokes involving wordplay. I don't like using the word "dadjoke", but that would probably describe my type of humor. You may also see me discussing topics about transgender rights, mental health, and other random things.

I also like to play and review indie games, so feel free to take a look at my profile page for my other social links if you want.

Here is a picture of me in a cute dress I just received in the mail a few days ago.

Thank you for reading!

content:
This video is a good #MastodonMigration guide: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BpI-SplOXVE

If you prefer written guides, this is extremely thorough: https://fedi.tips/transferring-your-mastodon-account-to-another-server/

Note that posts and engagements on posts do not transfer over. Follows and lists do, and your followers get updated on your new address. It can sometimes take a while for those server updates to propagate.

You can also use the Data export page in your mastodon.lol preferences to export CSVs or an entire archive of your data.

#MastodonLOL

content:
New to Mastodon?

Use #hashtags as often as possible.

This tells others what you like, what interests you have and so much more. Don't be scared to use them frequently.

Others will likely engage with you and your posts more frequently if you use hashtags, as they see hashtags that are of interest to them.

Users can search for and even follow a specific hashtag, allowing more eyes on your content in the long run.

#MastodonTips #MastodonMigration #TwitterMigration

content:
If picking a server makes Mastodon "too difficult" to use for some, it might be a blessing after all as it works as a filter against people who are just way too inept at technology.

It's good to have a minimum proficiency level for a user experience, or otherwise everything would be way too simplified and inefficient where it shouldn't be. Not everything has to grow to cover the entire planet.

#MastodonMigration

content:
New to Mastodon? Please take the time to do a couple of things.

1) Change your profile picture to something personal/meaningful about you as a person.

2) Fill in your bio. Tell everyone what things you're into, what #hashtags you are interested and anything else that helps us get to know you.

These things help give you an identity here that will help others know if they share the same interests as you.

#MastodonMigration #TwitterMigration #Mastodon #FediTips #MastodonTips #Tips

content:
Concerning #InstanceMigration
This may help others ~ Now 2 days after migration from mstdn.party I still have lost quite a few from list of folks I followed. Having small acct I was able to review archived list downloaded before change. ALL of people missing from my following list after migration were from mastodon.social instance. They now all showed as my following being pending. Maybe they would eventually complete process, but I found just clicking pending off and then refollowing solved the problem.
Note that steps I took likely not feasible with larger account. Mastodon.social is huge instance and if left alone 'pending' issue may have resolved on its own. I'll never know.
EDIT: These were not private accounts. #feditips #mastodonmigration :mastodon:

content:
Don't be ashamed if you got caught up in the @Mkbhd@techhub.social fake account.

It happens.

My advice?

(1) Ask your admin to disable :verified:, like what #MastodonWorld does.

(2) Check if the link to their website on their bio has a checkmark. It's basically a way that folks can verify their account from a domain name. I did it with my blog and GitHub, so you can see how it looks on my profile.

(3) Be kind to yourself.

#MastodonMigration #MastoTips #TwitterMigration #WeWantMKBHD #WhereIsLinus

content: Just something for everyone that scrapes Twitter for news and re-shares it on Mastodon. A lot of those URL's that you copy will have some internal UTM tags at the end. If you see something like "utm_source=Twitter", replace Twitter with Mastodon. The link will still work but the internal tracking tools will notice and if the traffic from Mastodon increases, they will be more interested at establishing a presence. #mastodonmigration #twittermigration

content:
@fatherroderick
Well, it's been 5 days and no replies (that I can see) so FWIW I'll give it a try. You can't add a hashtag to a list even if you are following the hashtag. I think it is something to do with the distributed server architecture.

I think the hashtags will show up in your home view. For me, that is not very useful as I only get to see a small amount of my home timeline before I move on. If you really want to know what is going on in a hashtag, it might be more efficient to go directly to the hashtag timeline for the full story.

Unfortunately that means multiple adventures to see what is exposed for your topic.

Some applications make the hashtags you follow into a menu and you can pick which one you want to browse. It is a nice feature even more so depending on how the menu is implemented.

#Mastodontips #mastodonmigration #mastodon

content:
@voron
I don't know anything but FWIW: The android app Fedilab provides a translate icon on the toot menu for toots using a language other than your preferred. I think you have to purchase Fedilab.

You can also get a free Chrome extension called Google Translate, probably works on the Microsoft browser as well. When you activate the extension other languages will have a translate icon next to the mouse when selected. I think it works anywhere,

Google Translate also comes as a windows utility. You can translate text, handwriting, photos, and speech in over 100 languages with the Google Translate app.

Good Luck!
#mastodontips
#mastodonmigration
#mastodonguide

I have closed one of my Twitter accounts (my spicy audiobook account) and I'm working on wrapping up my main, real name account.

The short term cost is that my audiobook sales have collapsed. I'm looking at revenue vs bills & it's going to be a cold & hungry winter.

Please keep in mind when you feel frustrated or judgemental about people who are still on Twitter, for some of us, it's about paying rent & buying food.

content: @charlieok I'm new but the vibe I get is that people want to control how easily they are "found" and by whom. I do agree that the current options are limited, even for those that wish to be more openly visible to all instances. The best trick I've found is to extensively search #hashtags. If you're intent on following subject/topics that's a very good method. If you're on Mastodon to follow "celebrities" then you've probably made a mistake. #mastodonmigration #mastodontips #mastodonhelp

content:
#MastodonMigration #HowToArchiveTwitterData
https://www.cnet.com/tech/services-and-software/download-all-your-tweets-and-dms-in-case-twitter-shuts-down

I've not yet left the #birdsite completely behind. It's been part of my life since May 2008.

ALL the memories of silliness with friends, & supporting causes that matter, & participating in important conversations with people from all over the globe that kicked off a lot of positive social change + exposing sources of online toxicity & hate.

This week, I'll archive my accounts, deal with the emotions, and close it all down.

content:
Cast your mind back to the mid-2000s. Where were you when you first found out about Firefox? How exciting was it to finally have an alternative to IE, and a superior one at that. Faster, safer, more freedom. IE became something you had to use, not something you wanted to use. I believe the last few months have marked Mastodon‚Äôs ‚ÄòFirefox moment‚Äô; word has spread, will continue to spread, and many do not want to go back.

#mastodon #mastodonmigration #fediverse

TIP - You are the algorithm üå∑

________

@Agora @majorlinux @BlackMastodon@chirp.social @blackmastodon@a.gup.pe

these charts showing how you see things may help.

Unlike a place where an algorithm is shoving things into your feed, here YOU are the algorithm. You chose what you see and engage with based on who YOU follow.

Follow lots of interesting people and your feed will be full and rich.

Use hashtags to find people talking about things that interest you too. Follow them.

Boost good stuff so others will also see it.

content:
I have officially reached the point in my #MastodonMigration where I have now followed so many people that I‚Äôm struggling to keep up with the number of posts flooding into my feed. My initial strategy was to follow anyone and everyone, and ‚Äòfix it later‚Äô by unfollowing accounts that didn‚Äôt add value.

The challenge I‚Äôm having now is that I‚Äôm finding that there are very few accounts I want to unfollow‚Äîand I‚Äôm still finding interesting folks that I want to add to my follows. ü´§

filtered_content: officially reached point followed people struggling number posts flooding feed initial strategy follow fix later accounts add value challenge finding accounts want unfollow finding interesting folks want add follows

content: @nspugh it‚Äôs a challenge for us because the content we rely on and share to our #Mastodon followers still mostly originates from #Twitter. It puts us in a tricky spot where we need to stay active on Twitter to stay informed but then repackage this info and share on Mastodon. The official accounts for local / regional government agencies and councils have not made the jump, and until they do, we have to keep one foot over there. #mastodonmigration

content:
Personal Story üßµ
Talk of #PublicDomain puts me in mind of a bot I have wanted to create ever since my #MastodonMigration ‚Äî but I would need some #BotHelp. I see bots tooting novels in sequence & I think toots are an amenable format for the 1914 experimental prose poem by #GertrudeStein Tender Buttons: Objects Food Rooms. In the past year I answered a prompt to share a #FoundationalText & Tender Buttons is one for me. I encountered it shortly before I began a lifetime of #AbstractPainting.
1/

For the last few years #TeamMassSpec was convinced and cajoled into joining Twitter. I‚Äôd peg it at 2-3k users with about 100 very active. What am I missing?

content:
Most striking theme of the Mastodon migration is how many folks try to recreate bird site here without understanding what lead them here.

It's a FOSS project governed by community. Ideas move slowly but thoughtfully. Reasoning comes before effort.

If you like everything about Bird site except it's current owner, Mastodon is probably not for you.

#foss #mastodon #mastodonmigration

content:
#Mastodon #MastodonMigration #twitter #twitterexodus #birdsite #TwitterMigration #Newhere #Newbie #MastodonTips

TIP - Using Content Warnings üå∑

Using Content Warnings (CWs) #welcome #NewUser 3/8

Content warnings are for any kind of content where the person reading may not want to read it right that minute, but they may want to read later.

You can add a content warning while writing a post by clicking on ‚ÄúCW".

There‚Äôs also a very strong Fediverse tradition that those who are able to should use CWs when talking about emotive topics such as politics or religion. It is also \ used for ‚Äúnot safe for work‚Äù content.

https://fedi.tips/staying-safe-on-mast
https://mastodon.sdf.org/@philippmichelreichold/109563076564767615

content:
Q: Do you feel like Mastodons search results are good enough?

#mastodon's search is limited by design. Not only bc its resource heavy in current architecture but also because they do not want people to find other discussions (trolls, companys, ...).
I assume resource consumption could be optimized. But I am wondering: Do you personally feel like the #search should stay that limited? Do you like that "no randoms start connecting" with you? Feel free to discuss below.

Consider Boosting üöÄ

#mastodon #mastodonmigration #mastodonhelp #poll

content:
#Welcome #Newhere #Mastodon
#Mastodon #MastodonMigration #twitter #twitterexodus #birdsite #TwitterMigration

TIP - Please "Boost", don't "Favorite"

If you favorite a post, it's a nice way to tell the poster you liked their post.

But the only one who will ever know that is the person who posted. No one else will see that you liked it. (Remember, no algorithms here.)

If you boost a post, it will show that post to other people.

So, if you think other people might also like the post, it's more important to boost it.

* And it would be a favor to the poster, because now their post will be seen by more people.

"Favorite" - only one person sees

"Boost" - shows post to other people who may be interested

content:
Good morning & joyful tidings of the season!

The amazing @quintessence gave me a pro tip for a better browsing experience.

Go to Profile > Preferences > Appearance > Animations & Accessibility > click Slow Mode

This will stop your timelines from autoloading new toots and scrolling away from the one you were reading. :(

To see the new toots, just click the bar at top where it says "## new toots"

content:
@mhoye

With the large #Mastodonmigration that's currently happening, so-called "expats" will soon far outnumber previous citizens.

Since this is a completely open source user controlled platform, it will become whatever the majority wants it to become.

Since the #fediverse isn't just Mastodon, expect many third party tools and future forks of the original code, including versions that support things that we need like quote tweeting and an algorithm to help sort the timeline and a functional text search.

It's unreasonable to expect so-called new arrivals to not change the culture. Because that's how culture works.

No one's objectively right or wrong in terms of whether these options should exist. The whole beauty of an open platform is that it evolves.

I quite like that favourited posts aren't part of what my followers see, only boosted posts. I was annoyed when that became a thing in the other place. It acknowledges there might be a difference between what I want to access and what I want to put out.

content:
#Joinin #Christmas #Newhere #Mastodon #MastodonMigration #twitter #birdsite
#twitterexodus #TwitterMigration @feditips

Merry Christmas üéÑ to you, kind Feditips person.

Never saw anything like this on TFsite.

Please Boost so will be found. Thank you.

________

feditips@mstdn.social
Fedi.Tips üéÑ
@feditips

Are you feeling lonely during the festive season? Have you tried the hashtag #JoinIn?

It works like this:

- During Xmas period, or any time, write about what you're doing and include the tag #JoinIn. It doesn't have to be anything elaborate or impressive!

- Search for (or follow) the tag #JoinIn, reply to other people's posts with that tag.

I know it sounds kind of simple, but it's worth trying!

I'm going to be on my own this year due to ongoing pandemic, but will see you at #JoinIn ‚òï

content:
üëç‚Äã WHO TO FOLLOW: Curatedüëç‚Äã - CREME DE LA CREME-
- READ TO END -

I am getting a lot of referals for recommended follows and have some accounts I particularly enjoy so here they are in a thread which I will update. Replies welcome.

I assume when you signed up you got recommended follows for "the heavies" like George Takei, Eugene, Mike Mastnick and so forth...

A. The Hashtags
Yes you can and probably should be following actual hashtags on Mastodon. I can't know where you r interests lie but I am sure you can figure this part out for yourself.

B. The People

So here are some other great #GreatMastodonians

The Great Dismal is William Gibson who needs no introduction:
@GreatDismal

@gretathunberg
You might have heard of her, she is a legend even now on Mars where she is honorary ambassador defeating Elon Musk by a decisive margin.

Among the many awesome women in tech, Kris Nova @nova author of "Hacking Capitalism: Modeling, Humans, Computers, and Money" runs a very cool instance that is also home to

@mekkaokereke one of the voices of #blackmastodon which said hashtag you might do well to follow along with #nativemastodon paying attention to the protocols of etiquette that may apply

@craignewmark is very decent guy and a big supporter of EFF and has a lot of perspectives you will want exposure to. You might have heard of his list...

@chadloder is a thorn in the side of a lot of malevolent actors notable among other things for exposing the Twitter data leak

Another well known cybersecurity expert everyone should follow, if they want their data to be remain private and secure is @briankrebs whose name is synonymous with infosec

@gorskon is David Gorskis MD MPH a double doctorate whose Skeptikal Raptor blog kept me sane through his ability to gently make fun of wacko anti-science wing nuts

@HelenBranswell is a top notch health journalist. Please reply if you find her colleague Laurie Garrett!

Also @gregggonsalves
@gregggonsalves@med- mastodon.com for health angle

@avid Action Versus Infectious Disease is a campaign I have run for over ten years aggregating sources such as This Week in Virology

@ThisWeekinLinux is a great podcast I follow

Award-winning human rights journalist @billweinberg is the visonary behind the Countervortex podcast

Yale historian Joanne Freeman
@jbf1755
Please reply if you find her colleague Timothy Snyder!

@yehuda is an exponent of justice for native/indigenous

@theghostoftomjoad is the creator of this original post please be sure to hit me with a follow and maybe a boost- it is surprising how many folks favorite this post but neglect to hit that follow button!

If you can't get enough US politics, you can hardly go wrong with @lolgop
and please reply if you find Tea Pain!

C. The Apps

Make sure to follow your own old acquaintanes from Twitter!
This would include the use of apps and by the way, run more than one app because they don't work perfectly - some apps will pick up accounts the others miss!

https://debirdify.pruvisto.org/
https://fedifinder.glitch.me/
https://fedifinder-v1.glitch.me/
https://www.twitodon.com/

D. The Straglers

Who do you know that is still on twitter and has not come over yet?

Please let us know!

E. The end.

=== Please follow the OP=====
Original Post: @theghostoftomjoad
==========================
If you find this helpful you might also boost thank you in advance
=========================

I recently posted a video describing the #MastodonMigration from Twitter and asking my followers to join up. Very glad to report that a number of them did. It's still early days and there is much to do still, but all the same I am hopeful that those who are just making their way here will find it an enjoyable experience.

Once I get a bit more knowledge under my belt I am planning on sharing some of the coolest tips I became aware of which helped me out!

content:
Twitter's policy prohibiting linking to other social media sites is gone, but #WebArchiving remembers!

This policy and reversal were posted the same day. Fortunately, someone captured the evidence for #DigitalHistory.

The now deleted tweet:

https://web.archive.org/web/20221218183504/https://www.twitter.com/TwitterSupport/status/1604531261791522817

and the policy:

https://web.archive.org/web/20221218182922/https://help.twitter.com/en/rules-and-policies/social-platforms-policy

were captured thanks to the "Save Page Now" capability at @internetarchive: http://web.archive.org/save

#IfYouSeeSomethingSaveSomething #MastodonMigration #TwitterMigration #TwitterTakeover

content:
I was all ready to deactivate my bird site account but it turns out that when you do that, you lose your 2FA protection and anyone can take over your handle after 30 days. So, I re-activated, set myself to private and logged out.
In other words, bird site is basically the Hotel California. You can check out any time you like but (if you care about your security or digital identity) you can never leave. #twittermigration #mastodonmigration #cybersec

content:
#Mastodon #MastodonMigration #twitter
#twitterexodus #birdsite #TwitterMigration @rmc_vu

TIP - Another thought on "Boosting"

If the icon for boosting is purple, then it is showing that you boosted it. If it's black, you can boost it.

If you really want to boost it again, you can click the icon that is purple. This will make it go black. And then you can immediately click it a second time. That will make it purple. Effectively, you are updating your boost. So, reboosting.

You are much too nice to annoy people by doing this too often.

Still, good to know. üå∑

content:
#Mastodon #MastodonMigration #twitter
#twitterexodus #birdsite #TwitterMigration @rmc_vu

TIP - Why it's more helpful if you click "Boost" than if you click "Favorite"

If you click on favorite, the only person who will ever see that is the person who posted.
What will that accomplish?
The person who wrote it will know you liked it.

If you click on boost, other people will get to see that post.
What will that accomplish?
You will be letting other people see a post that you might feel is helpful/interesting to them.

Since there's no algorithm here deciding what you should, or should not, see, everything that everyone posts is in chronological order.

If you think others would like to see the post, please click on boost. üå∑

content:
One tricky thing about the #mastodonmigration: leaving ranking behind. It's convenient to have platforms predict what we want to see. They're good at it! But we're probably better at it.

Still, curating your own TL takes work (which we are not used to)! I'm doing this largely through building out lists, which I wish we could share/follow, as you can on the other app. It would also be great to have a "priority follow" option, too (short of turning on notifications for a profile).

-23/26 believe they will still be using Mastodon in 3 months

content:
What I like about Mastodon beyond the fact that trolls can't find you as easily and you can use terms like racism, feminism, and trans rights, without a horde of randos infesting your mentions, it's that when you do mute or block someone they just vanish. There's no "this tweet is from an account you muted/blocked, click 'show' to see what they said?", so there's nothing nudging you towards seeing content you chose to avoid.

content:
Hot take on joining #Mastodon as a professional or company:

If you want to join mastodon and already have a custom domain and email e.g. person@company.com please consider making your own Mastodon server for your brand. There are plenty of managed hosts you can pay to have this done. Not only is this how the fediverse was designed to be decentralized and used, but it looks way more professional and all your employees or colleagues can share it with you too! #twittermigration #mastodonmigration

content:
@ancient_catbus

Re: timeline delays

It's not really your timezone. It is due to propagation delays between instances. They get backed up.

Especially now with the #MastodonMigration

The servers are busy.

This is why you may see boosts from someone you follow that is boosting someone else you already follow but you never saw the original post. Happens a lot.

You will miss posts. Get used to it.

Otherwise, you have to specifically check a specific users profile.

You will miss stuff.

I would not worry about it. If it is important and newsworthy, you will learn of it anyway.

#ux

content:
I am constantly surprised at how good the Unfollow, Mute, and Block options make me feel.

I've followed then unfollowed a lot of very loud, very prolific posters that had clout & notoriety on other spaces. It's clear their staff is very skilled at dropping anxiety-laden posts, but they don't engage or follow anyone. I have yet to see actual replies to any responses to their posts. Might as well be a bot.

I think I'm done with that. I'm raising my standards.

#politics #bot #MastodonMigration

content:
One of the many beauties of an open protocol/platform: many more clients, with full access to all features (unlike Twitter‚Äôs stunted API). Not just OS apps, but alternative websites. Here‚Äôs one: https://elk.zone/mstdn.party/@stewf

No multicolumn view yet, but does offer something big I was missing: log into multiple accounts at once.

Thank you, @antfu @danielroe @sxzz @patak!

#MastodonMigration #Feditips #MastodonTips #MastodonClients #ElkClient

content:
#MastodonMigration > #TwitterMigration

Reasons:
1) Alliteration
2) Mastodons actually migrate* (admittedly birds do too)
3) Center what matters (i.e. our community)
4) Migrating to someplace is different than fleeing from someplace.

*I  ú·¥Ä·¥†·¥á …¥·¥è …™·¥Ö·¥á·¥Ä …™“ì M·¥Äs·¥õ·¥è·¥Ö·¥è…¥s ·¥Ä Ä·¥á ·¥ç…™…¢ Ä·¥Ä·¥õ·¥è Ä è.

content:
I've watched drama play out on the internet for years in one way or another, always in a bit of a detached way. I heard about Gamergate years after the fact, I didn't use socials often while Qanon was losing its collective mind, and I never signed up to TikTok. So this stuff on the bird site is the first time I've actually been present at time of posting for a meltdown like this.

I have to say, it's very funny to watch the physical embodiment of perpetual teenage brain throw hissy fits and set fire to billions, but I've never appreciated just how much these people are able to ruin peoples lives. I'm now not sure how I can effectively promote the Kickstarter I was planning for later in the year. I don't know how to grow a network of authors to get in touch with if I get published. Hell, despite having only a few hundred followers, I had *friends* that have disappeared after the twitter exodus. I don't know how to find them now.

None of it is catastrophic for me and I'm not going to starve for it, but there's probably people who are because birdsite is how they sell their work. When that manbaby nukes the site, he's nuking their ability to earn a living.

I know I'm very late to this realisation, but oh my god. Fuck Elon. So much.

#TwitLand #MastodonMigration #TwitterIsDoomed

content:
Six weeks after joining Mastodon, I get one dominant impression compared to the birdsite.

The algorithm _flattens_.

To gain "popularity" in the birdsite a content creator must create a "brand": they must flatten themselves to the thinnest consumable unit.

The algorithm does not reward multiple facets, it's confused by them.

Which is probably why twitters often resort to rage-farming: rage-farming may be the thinnest consumable unit of content.

#MastodonMigration #JohnMastodon #UserStyles

content:
Mastodon stats update.

Firehose landmark day!

Yesterday wasn't the biggest surge of new users - that was when there was a panic about the birdsite possibly collapsing on a November weekend.
But, if this is right, it was a critical landmark. Over half a billion posts in a day for the first time!

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1CX_FCmuDIQTC7E0RpdGlhXIjahncnGmuxsvqZlXO9Zk/edit?usp=sharing

Important background on making sense of Mastodon stats at my @PLOS blog:
https://absolutelymaybe.plos.org/2022/12/05/mastodon-growth-numbers-might-not-mean-what-you-think-they-mean/

Source data is 2 in the table there.

content:
Dear everyone,

While you're getting used to this new space, for those who complain how "we can't find anybody we know", or "this is hard", just remember that once upon a time, you migrated from WordStar through WordPerfect to Word, from AOL to Yahoo to Gmail , from AltaVista to AskJeeves to Google, from Netscape to Explorer to Chrome (or Opera, etc), and from ICQ to MySpace to to Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and TikTok.

You're all smart. Adaptable. Savvy. You got this.

And, when all else fails in your migration from Twitter to Mastodon, always remember the first principles that bound us together through every move : cat photos. If in doubt, post your pets. Your friends will find you.

#MastodonMigration

content:
@AdamKorengold Yes, I have noticed that too. The "outrage machine" is limited here--so far. No one person can manipulate a feed to feature particular individuals' posts or reduce the reach of others.

Every person controls: follows, boosts, mutes, blocks (even servers), and reports. We have Favorites, Bookmarks, and Lists as before. Most importantly, we can Filter anything, including words, phrases, names, and hashtags.

We're in control of our experience here. It's a relief.
#MastodonMigration

content:
@trishgreenhalgh
#Welcome #Newhere #Mastodon
#MastodonMigration #twitter #birdsite
#twitterexodus #TwitterMigration

TIP - To see more in your feed

You build what you see. There's no algorithm here, so no one sees what you like or what you do, then decides what goes into your feed.

It's all chronological; a nice rolling screen of posts in the order they're made.

So, if you want to see more, and particularly more of interest to yourself, there are things you can do.

It's quite easy.

1 hashtags

Use a hashtag to describe what you're writing about. Or use a hashtag to describe your interests. Sprinkle liberally throughout your posts. This will attract people to you, because they're looking for you, too.

2 following

Follow people.
Choose by whatever metrics you like. I've been more expansive here than on the other place, and it's already enriched my timeline.

In your home feed (what you see you when you click the house icon) you will see posts by people you follow, and maybe by people they follow.

It's an experiment!
We're all new here. Give it a couple of days and your feed will change.

Boosting is important here - more important than favoriting.

Soon, you'll be driving your own custom car again. Please let me know if this works.

(I'm posting TIPs periodically to help people.)

Please boost this - so other people will see it, if you feel it's useful. Thanks.

content:
#Mastodon #MastodonMigration #twitter #twitterexodus #birdsite #TwitterMigration #Words #writing #WritingCommunity

"...predicting a drop in worldwide Twitter users for the first time since it began tracking the social network in 2008, saying that after completing 2022 essentially flat, at 368.4 million monthly active users, that total will slide 3.9% in 2023 to 353.9 million and another 5.1% in 2024 to 335.7 million‚Äîdown 32.7 million users in two years.

Insider Intelligence sees the biggest cuts coming from the U.S., where it is projecting a 6.3% year-over-year drop in 2023, followed by an 8.3% plunge in 2024, bringing the total for the country down to 50.5 million MAUs, its lowest since 2014.

The research service predicted that the downturn in the U.S. will be especially pronounced among users under 25 and over 45.

‚ÄúThere won‚Äôt be one catastrophic event that ends Twitter. Instead, users will start to leave the platform next year as they grow frustrated with technical issues and the proliferation of hateful or other unsavory content. Twitter‚Äôs skeleton staff, working around the clock, won‚Äôt be able to counteract the platform‚Äôs infrastructure and content moderation problems.‚Äù

https://www.adweek.com/media/insider-intelligence-sees-twitter-shedding-327m-users-by-the-end-of-2024/

content:
30 days on #Mastodon thoughts
- reports on how technically confusing Mastodon is are vastly overstated
- the #natsec #military #extremism #intelligence communities seem thin on the ground
- I didn‚Äôt realize just how much Twitter was an outrage machine, even with a carefully curated followers list
- I still miss quote posts and easier gif integration (but I‚Äôll live)
- overall a really positive experience

#mastodonmigration

content: I'm glad to see that @popehat decided to leave Twitter for real last night. I'm disappointed that he went to post.news rather than the fediverse. It wasn't a "this place doesn't do everything Twitter does" reason by the sounds of it. It wasn't that post.news is perfect either. It was the between the two he found post.news had a bit more ease of use and less problems. Some of that was because he came over in the heat of the #TwitterMigration so the instances were buckling. Some of it is we have some UX work to do on the fediverse. As we improve hopefully bringing more of those people to here will happen as well. #postnews #MastodonMigration

content:
#Welcome #Newhere #Mastdon
#MastodonMigration #twitter
#twitterexodus #birdsite #TwitterMigration

TIP - If you leave Twitter - More Ideas

More ideas.

________

Marcus Hutchins
<:verified:.png>
@malwaretech

FWIW I don't recommend outright deleting your Twitter account. After 30 days your username becomes free so anyone can register it to impersonate you. Deleting your account also doesn't delete your data from their system. Best thing to do is set your bio to your Mastodon handle, then periodically tweet a list of places where your followers can find you so your account isn't deleted for inactivity.
Dec 12, 2022

content:
#Welcome #Newhere #Mastodon
#MastodonMigration #twitter
#twitterexodus #birdsite #TwitterMigration

TIP - If you leave Twitter

1
Please boost this. If you deactivate/delete your Tw*tter account, your @ handle will be publicly available in 30 days. The chances that you will be impersonated with no recourse is very high! Don‚Äôt do it - especially if you had a fairly popular account.

To wipe things, deactivate your account, then go to bird site /login and reactivate it. All of your followers will be gone. Now lock the account and let it rot. @semiphemeral is a great tool for wiping data, including DMs.

#twittermigration
https://aus.social/@thedragstate/109377827512403023

2

https://medium.com/illumination/how-to-leave-twitter-738ae2b0783e

I'm opening my Mastodon instance (hear-ye.com) to the public now that I'm done testing it for the past few weeks. @StevenBeschloss the role of #socialmedia platforms that enable, ignore or pretend to be concerned about misinformation, extremist views ( at end of the political spectrum) and the role they play in radicalisation and the lag between what‚Äôs allowed or ignored and the legislation in various countries cannot, I think, be under estimated. Despite the storming of Capital Hill, Biden is yet to enforce changes after the US finally signed the Christchurch Call.
Self- regulation does not work and apparently neither do politicians. People opting to #mastodonmigration from Twitter will hopefully make social media for many here less stressful, more ‚Äúsocial‚Äù and enjoyable but it could simply encourage more fruitloops, far right loonies and serious extremists to preach to each other and the impressionable.

content:
Fellow Mastodonnies: this is not Twitter.

The Content Wrapper is there for a reason: to hide content from people who either don't want to see it, or who enjoy unwrapping and discovery. If in doubt, wrap it, but especially: politics, war, argument.

And hashtags also help readers to filter content. Please use them as much as you can!

Without these, the only way people can filter your posts is to unfollow, block etc. If I've chosen to follow you, it would be a shame to stop.

#MastodonMigration

content:
Have you ever wondered how many Mastodon users other people follow?

Most active Mastodon users follow around 150 other people. (That's the median number anyway. So half follow less than 150, and the other half follow more than 150.)

About 10% of active Mastodon users follow more that 600 people.

About 10% of active Mastodon users follow less than 15 people.

The full distribution is based on a large sample of active Mastodon users.

#Mastodon #MastodonTips #MastodonMigration #Follow

content:
This is a decent and approachable 9 page overview on the challenges of content moderation. I commend it to all those who are working on #MastodonMigration issues.

My concern with this article is that while it mentions issues of race and culture, it treats them as a technical challenge instead of the fundamental issue that it is. The concern I want to raise it the inability of most content moderation systems to differentiate between what the paper terms bad-actors and people who have different cultural communication norms. Hate speech and harassment are most typically defined in the context of white "polite society" culture which ends up excluding BIPOC, LGBTQ+, and other oppressed groups ability to express themselves.

#fediblock #TwitterMigration #moderation #HateSpeech #mastodon
QT: https://mastodon.lawprofs.org/@ericgoldman/109422417748002295
tags: mastodonmigration, fediblock, twittermigration, hatespeech, mastodon, moderation

content:
To my previous boost I would add:

Follow freely! I've been way less selective with my follows in my early days so that I could build up a timeline and see what people are talking about and, importantly, which accounts they're boosting. I'm sure I'll pare back after a while, but for now it's been a really helpful way for me to get started here.

Also: remember that hashtags are your friend on Mastodon. Use them in your posts so they'll be discovered by others.

#MastodonMigration #MastodonTips

"We will make this **new** social media platform our own! We will re-imagine social media and rediscover the lost promise of the internet!! Follow me, pilgrims!"

I feel really sorry for the hundreds of thousands of people who've been here since like, 2017, happily minding their own damn business.

#embarrassed #sorryAboutThat #TwitterMigration #TwitterExodus #NewHere #MastodonMigration

:-/

content:
@TNLNYC Another option is to do something to get banned. I don't believe they allow anyone to register a banned account again. At least they didn't use to. I had changed usernames then tried to switch back to the old username. It didn't allow me to because someone else had used it and been banned by then.

To delete anything you want from your Twitter history, you can use semiphemeral.com. Doing this is certainly not required, but your choice.

#TwitterMigration
#MastodonMigration
#InfoSec

content:
@honeymango You're welcome.

Found it! To see all your "connected apps" on your Twitter account and revoke any of them, go to (on desktop browser - mobile is probably a similar path):

More / Settings and Support / Settings and Privacy / Security and Account Access / Apps and Sessions / Connected Apps.

From there, select any apps for which you want to review or revoke access, then select revoke.

#MastodonMigration
#TwitterMigration
#InfoSec

content:
@spacerookie
Because we're on different servers, to #boost helps get the message out.

Sometimes you have to copy /paste a URL in order to like, favorite, reply or share.

When you boost, you expedite getting the message through.

"Favorites" still have some value in signalling appreciation and the prospect of like minds ;> mutuals. But if the post is worth a #favorite it is likely worth a boost.
IMO
#welcome #twittermigration #mastodonmigration

content:
I took some further steps to disconnect from Twitter. Unfollowed everyone except those who follow me, made my profile protected/private, removed my tweets, replies, and retweets, and finally removed all my likes (bookmarked tweets I wanted to keep for reference on my browser).

One thing I noticed was that I only started heavily interacting with Twitter once the pandemic started.

Preparing to eventually delete my account completely.

#MastodonMigration #TwitterMigration

content:
My #MastodonMigration feels like when I'm at a party and think:

"Hey, why are we all crowding in this weird room where it's hard to hear or do anything? Why don't we move over into that lovely room over there?"

So I go and find a cozy chair, relax, and wait for others to show up. And usually have the most pleasant conversations of the night with the other folk also looking for a less chaotic space.

content:
New to Mastodon? Here's a great tip!

Once you get your profile setup, then make an #introduction post and introduce yourself to the #fediverse and to other users.

Tell us who you are, where you're from, what you do in life each day and most of all, provide a list of #hashtags of subjects you're interested in and that you will be posting about.

Make your post capture us and want to interact with you going forward.

#FediTips #MastodonTips #MastodonMigration #TwitterMigration

content:
Which Mastodon server for me?

By now, I have created account on multiple Mastodon servers. And deleted one. There are are quirks everywhere.

All the servers do basic job alright. Except that,

1. Some are small and operated by individuals (nothing wrong) with limited resources.

2. Some are quite big but in another country.

3. Some are interest based.

4. Some are heavily moderated.

I wish I didn't have to choose from so many. But that is just me.

#mastodonmigration #servers #decision

content:
Outrage feeds engagement. Perhaps that's a cynical comment on human nature, but I think it's so. While Mastodon, to it's credit and by design, minimizes dunking and piling-on, I'm not sure that's going to lead to a huge growth in users. Leo Durocher famously said, "Nice guys finish last." There's something like that in play in social media

#Twitterexodus #twittermigration #mastodon #mastodonmigration #contentwarnings #safespaces

content:
TIP OF THE DAY

Change The Image Cropping Setting

One thing about Mastodon that is pretty annoying is that by default embedded images are clipped at the edges. This can make it impossible to read text images without expanding the post. You can disable image cropping in your preferences under Post Layout, making it much easier to browse your feed.

#twittermigration #mastodonmigration #NewUser #mastodontips #feditips
@mastodonmigration

content:
So, after a couple of weeks on this site, I'm beginning to find my way around. And I have found the key to it all ( apart from boost/follow anything/anyone who grabs your attention) is LISTS!
Yes, lists. Set up a whole bunch of lists. Then when you follow someone, put them on a list. That way you can keep up with what they post, whichever server they are on in the Fediverse.

content:
#MastodonMigration #Feditips #Fediverse #MastodonHelp

Block a domain from a web browser more details since I found it tricky.
- Open another browser tab and go to the domain/instance and click on the admin profile
- copy the URL to the clipboard
- From main browser tab click on Home
- paste the URL into the Mastodon search box (upper left on screen)
- open the profile.
- select block from the three dot icon next to the Follow button.

https://universeodon.com/@edfoss/109395924878106939

content:
#MastodonMigration #Feditips #Fediverse #MastodonHelp
IMO it is important to understand why you might wish to block an instance before doing so.
Do some research and think for yourself.

How to block an entire instance
https://docs.joinmastodon.org/user/moderating/#block-domain

It was tricky but here's what finally worked for me.

- copy the server admin's address to clipboard
- click on Home
- paste the address into the Mastodon search box
- open the profile.
- select block from the three dot icon next to the Follow button.

content:
Daily migration to Mastodon, although slowed from the surge on 18th and 19th November, is still double what it used to be at start of the November.

Now two thousand registrations per hour, compared to one thousand at start of November.

For comparison back in October there used to be only about 50 registrations per hour.

@mastodonusercount
#riptwitter #Mastodon #MastodonMigration

content:
#introduction

I am a trauma and mental health researcher. My two (related) areas of research focus on mental health in the wake of trauma.

1. I'm interested in symptom dynamics following trauma exposure. I use EMA and ESM and other repeated measures designs to collect data over time.

2. I am also focused on public mental health following mass trauma/disasters.

I'm not convinced I have cracked the whole #mastodonmigration trick yet... Feel free to reach out for a follow!

IMO most of the people weren't really interested in anything I had to write about, they just wanted followers to placate the algorithms.
After a while I stopped doing that and learned to get by without being famous.

No one has to do that here - just follow the people you find interesting and focus on producing the best content you can.

content:
#MastodonMigration #Fediverse
How to explain the recent system slowdowns and long waiting queues.

Imagine a band booking their first gig not expecting a big crowd.
The day before they release a new song which goes viral.
Ten times the expected number go to the show and 90% are disappointed as they cannot get in.
The band cannot get a bigger venue that night - it might take a few days.

The #Tootaverse sys admins have been scrambling to build a bigger venue but it takes time.

content: I don't want to minimize the serious issue we are going to have with moderating the fediverse. If moderation were easy we would have solved it by the time USENET Newsgroups went out of fashion. That said these are microcosms of the same problem faced on the big tech walled garden tech platforms like Twitter and Facebook as well. The difference between here and there is you can choose from thousands of instances or even have one of your own stood up. Tensions are higher than normal with all the transitions going on. We should try to treat good faith actors new and old here generously in their intentions but remember unlike every other social network in existence you aren't stuck at the mercy of one or a handful of people that own "the network". #TwitterMigration #MastodonMigration #Fediverse #moderation #ModerationErrors

content:
@bararchy Absolutely. Mastodon is all about engagement, not influence. The idea of organically building up an audience is pretty daunting to them, coming from a place where the algorithm magnifies their voices so dramatically. They come here and post something, and when they don't get 10,000 meaningless likes, it's back to the bird. It's sad that the perceived Twitter fame and influence is more important than the principles they espouse.

#twittermigration #mastodonmigration #algorithm

Still a newbie here.

What is the protocol/etiquette on posting about topics/information that is not related to the server you're connected to or related tot he subject/peers you're surrounded with?

The other site I mainly followed people in the Cyber Security field but would occasionally be off topic. I tried not to stray too much but some issues were either too important or too funny not to share. I usually (but sometimes fail to ) stay away from polarizing issues like politics and religion. Just learning the boundaries. The other site was so easy to just blurt out whatever.

content:
It occurred to me this morning that the #mastodonmigration is like if millions of Windows users suddenly started using Linux.

Windows users: Wait, Linux is not one thing?

Linux people: No, it's a 'kernel' that talks to your hardware. On top of that, there are various communities that package 'distros' into a complete OS.

Windows users: That's confusing

Linux people: Not really. Pick a distribution you like and use it.

content: @NatureMC @jeffjarvis For me (and I realize this is well-trodden ground), the most objectionable thing about for-profit, corporate social media like #Twitter and #Facebook is that the algorithms they use to boost engagement reward hate speech, violent content, and malicious misinformation as much if not more than they reward substantive conversation, creativity, and real news. That's a conscious choice on the part of the platforms' CEOs and developers. #MastodonMigration #MastodonRefugee

content:
@Zanni There are plusses and minuses to any architecture. Twitter is one large cloud, and the problem there is that one catastrophic event (like being purchased by a capricious billionaire) can wipe out the data of the entire planet. The Fediverse distributed architecture may seem complicated, but it is pretty similar to other distributed systems like email and designed for resilience and scalability.

#mastodonmigration #twittermigration #mastodontips

content:
#MastodonMigration
When I joined this instance there were 16K users - now 39K (+244% in 9 days).

mastodon.au had less than 1K now it's over 15K - Crikey!

Be patient servers like mastodon.social are slow (it went from 184K to 240K+ in last 10 days).
The #Fediverse needs time to adjust/grow - it will get there.

The #Tootaverse is expanding rapidly.

To anyone coming here from #BirdSite, thank you, I wish you a great experience here.

FYI most of the software on the server is probably FOSS.

content:
After a week or so of #twittermigration a few things on #learningmastodon:

üíõ I love the culture of content warning and alt text for images. Taking care of strangers & not having to manage everything through blocks/mutes.

ü§ó Hashtags and the federated timeline really work for connecting with new people.

‚≠êÔ∏è No algorithm and no promoted content makes engagement more meaningful, searches more relevant, and numbers less important.

‚òéÔ∏è I miss DM groups, but we are finding each other in other apps (#discord), and there‚Äôs something about a small instance community. #beigelove

ü¶ê It is becoming clear that a shrimp did not fry this rice.

#mastodonmigration
#gratitudesunday
#introduction
#cultureshock #assimilation #community #twitter

content:
@charlotteclymer Welcome! Welcome!

Tips: It is considered good courtesy (not a requirement!) to use CW (Content Wrappers) for anything that might be triggering. Think of it as a headline.
Also consider include a #USPol hashtag if it is about US Politics so it can be located by those are interested and filtered by those who are not.

@mastodonmigration has lots more information and links and so does the site >>> https://medium.com/@mastodonmigration/sharing-advice-and-assisting-with-the-great-mastodon-migration-53c1a286b805

content:
I'm extremely grateful for #Mastodon and the #Fediverse.

The corruption and collapse of Twitter has been very scary and destabilising for me. I spent 12+ years building up a platform and a network that I rely on very heavily (too much!) for so many things. My fear and sadness has been really softened by having #ThisPlace as a sanctuary and a real source of hope.

I'm so grateful for everyone who has helped to build and maintain it!

#TwitterMigration #MastodonMigration

content:
They do this with more computers. Most of these larger systems use datacenters like you‚Äôve seen in the movies. A big instance probably does not own the machines and is leasing the computing and storage on a monthly basis from a datacenter company. To add capacity they lease more stuff. Then they need to make it all work, again at sea in a storm with another huge wave bearing down. So you get the picture.
8/9 more>>>

#twittermigration #mastodontips #mastotips #server #queues #mastodonmigration
tags: mastodonmigration, queues, server, MastoTips, mastodontips, twittermigration

content:
In this situation (now it‚Äôs 13h) it‚Äòs all hands on deck. The ship‚Äôs taking on water. Not foundering‚Ä¶yet, but got to get the pumps working! Normally, things might drop off at night and the system could recover. But, when the perfect storm hits like today and yesterday, the water just continues to rise, and they need bigger pumps. What‚Äôs more they need to get them working in the middle of the storm.
7/9 more>>>

#twittermigration #mastodontips #mastotips #server #queues #mastodonmigration

content:
That‚Äôs what the lower priority queue jobs do. If the server is overloaded those jobs don‚Äôt get done and the Federated timeline falls behind. But, the really important stuff like publishing your posts and sending them out do get done. If you start getting nasty 502 errors then those jobs are not getting done either. It‚Äôs all about processing power and the amount of work that needs to get done.
6/9 more>>>

content:
The way Mastodon works is that everyone‚Äôs data is stored on their own instance server. When you publish a post it is stored on your server, but it is also stored on the server of EVERYONE WHO FOLLOWS YOU. That is, it is sent (Federated) to the followers server and stored there too.
5/9 more>>>

content:
Still there?‚Ä¶ Mastodon uses different queues for tasks of varying importance. The most important queues get taken care of first. It‚Äôs like boarding group 1. Well, back in boarding group 4 and 5 are the jobs that fetch information from the other servers and mange # searches.

Wait what?... fetching information from other servers? OK‚Ä¶
4/9 more>>>

#twittermigration #mastodontips #mastotips #server #queues #mastodonmigration #mastoadmin
tags: mastodonmigration, queues, server, mastotips, mastodontips, twittermigration, mastoadmin
cleaned_content: mastodon uses different queues tasks varying importance important queues taken care like boarding group boarding group jobs fetch information servers mange searches wait fetching information servers
filtered_content: mastodon uses different queues varying importance important queues taken care like boarding group boarding group jobs information servers searches wait information servers

content:
Every job has to line up at the back of the queue and the server services the jobs one after another. When things are working right the server has plenty of time to handle each job and the queues are very short. Everyone is happy.

But when there is too much work to do and not enough server power, the queues can back up. That is what is happening to your Federated timeline.
3/9 more>>>

#twittermigration #mastodontips #mastotips #server #queues #mastodonmigration
tags: mastodonmigration, queues, server, mastotips, mastodontips, twittermigration

filtered_content: job line queue server services jobs things working right server plenty time handle job queues short happy work server power queues happening federated timeline

content:
If this is happening to you, go ahead and click on the world icon on the right. This shows you your Federated feed. Note that this is also running behind. In our case now 12hr behind. This is because there is too much work for the server to do and something has to give.

So hang on here‚Ä¶ Mastodon has things called queues which are... queues for handling jobs the server needs to do.
2/9 more>>>

content:
#mastodonmigration polls: Nov 8 and Nov 18 on twitter and mastodon

Obvious: Selection bias of polling location, Mastodon responders more bullish on the experiment than Twitter responders. It would have been shocking if this had not occurred.

Assuming similar sampling over time, the modal response is steady, but the distribution has shifted w/ (over-interpreting) 6% of most skeptical twitter responders moving up a point and 6% of "unlikely" responders moving up.

content:
Whoa! Why didn't I think of this sooner?

I used the Hermit app from the Google Play Store to create a web-app of the Vivaldi Social mobile homepage.

I now have a clear interface, with more functionality than the official Mastodon app or third-party apps offer.

Simply enter the URL of your Mastodon server's homepage, and make a frameless app.

It's not perfect, as my keyboard is obscuring some of the text when publishing - but it's a start

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.chimbori.hermitcrab

#mastodonmigration @Vivaldi

content:
A big thank you to all who have donated at https://kolektiva.info/donate/ :blob_pat_anar_raccoon:

And thanks as well to all those broke-as-a-joke dumpster divers who spanged and didn't give a penny, but some how found us, Seriously up da punx :acabkitty:

#Kolektiva started the week with around 5k users and as the birds flew the coop :birdsite: our little part of the fediverse filled with cast-aways, weirdos, lovers, fighters, rebels, sinners blossomed into a 19k user instance super charged with quality conversations that are personal, hilarious and bold.

The #KolektivaMod team and our little tech team have been doing our best to keep up with the #MastodonMigration and all that it entails.. The donated pirate booty üí∞ y'all have sent us will go directly to funding server hardware resources and we plan an upgrade on the 23rd of Nov. We hope to resolve some minor database issues and upgrade to Mastodon 4.x when we're ready.ü§û

Revolutionary solidarity with #AnarchistPrisoners
Props to #BlackTwitter for breaking free with an online riot for #Autonomy :sparkles_panafrican:

Solidarity means Attack, and in attack we find our communes
Nothing stops - everything continues.

- SubComandante KA0

Hi, new friends. Mastodon culture is all-in on #accessibility. For folks like me who are practitioners in creative/tech industries, adding alt-text to images and captions to videos is inherent. But for many it‚Äôs a new concept.

Here‚Äôs a good primer/discussion on how to add alt-text to images on Mastodon:

https://weirder.earth/@packbat/108183898988768624

Key things to remember:

1. Brief but descriptive
2. Important/relevant info
3. Always take the time to do this

#MastodonMigration #TwitterMigration

content:
What will the future look like if Mastodon becomes more dominant?

I believe Mastodon will have forks (modified copies of its free and open source code) leading to new competitors in the fediverse.

The larger players of Twitter, Facebook and Instagram may open up to dedicating a timeline to the fediverse. For example, users of Twitter can access the fediverse but have a seperate feed for it but Tweets won't be in the fediverse.

#Mastodon #Twitter #TwitterMigration #Fediverse #MastodonMigration

content:
Looking to find folks from #twitter on #mastodon for your #mastodonmigration ?

Step 0. Get folks to put their Mastodon handle in their Twitter bio.

Step 1: Add your Mastodon profile link to your Twitter bio.

Step 2: Use https://pruvisto.org/debirdify/ or https://www.fedifinder.com to automatically find the Mastodon accounts of those you follow on Twitter.

Step 3: Import the files generated by either tool into Mastodon to automatically follow.

content:
Tip to the new #twitterrefugees:

#favourite (aka #favorite aka #like) doesn't work the same way as in #twitter.

There are no algorithms that automatically show the liked #toot to your connections (I don't like the word #followers)

You'll actually have to tap/click on #boost (aka #retweet) a post that you like so that your connections will see it.

#twittermigration
#mastodonmigration
#followfriday
#followbackfriday

content:
#TwitterMigration #TwitterExodus #MastodonMigration

Anyone new here and wondering about the familiar looking blue checkmarks?

It's an emoji, not verification.

Instances (servers) can integrate custom emojis for their users and some of them are very unique and creative.

Not all servers allow the blue check emoji which is where it gets a lil confusing, especially upon arrival.

Check out @feditips for more info on mastodon and the fediverse

content:
@jeffjarvis Hopefully, this will be the future.

A good model is email. Organizations have their own email addresses for several reasons, not the least of which is that they want to own the data.

And not just news orgs. Governments, companies, academic institutions, NGOs...

The biggest issue is not technical. They would have to do content moderation. They would need to employ people to do content moderation.

content:
@mike @jeff The biggest issue is not technical. A service provider market for Mastodon instancing could address this with packages of all sizes. The bigger issue is content moderation. Each instance would have to administer content moderation. This means that they would need to employ people to do the content moderation function. This is very different from the tech admin function and takes a different skill set.
#twittermigration #mastodonmigration #CW #MastodonServiceProviders #fediverse #MSP

content:
Mastodon tip for all the new folks!

Remember, #Mastodon doesn't have an algorithm for posts. You see what gets posted as it gets posted.

Therefore, if you're wanting to not miss posts from certain/specific accounts, then turn on notifications for that account or add them to a #list and then view that list at any time to see what you might have missed.

#MastodonTips #FediTips #Tips #Helpful #Fediverse #TwitterMigration #MastodonMigration

content: Journal entry #1 End of #MastodonMigration Week 1: It's been interesting. I find myself not missing the little blue bird site, though I have been checking in daily. I prefer the quieter approach here where I see what I see when I look and miss the rest without a care. I'm enjoying the German posts. I've had some brief interesting conversations. I've met some people I already knew in real life & only online. I have expanded my reading interests and topics. I think I'll stay awhile, if not longer.

content:
TIP OF THE DAY

Mastodon is not broken.

It's different, and much better. Mastodon by design promotes engagement not asserting influence. It's a dinner party, not a food fight. Most of what you might at first think is deficient is intentional. Before you rush to conclusions, try it for a while. Take part in this new community. Make new friends. Be kind. This is what social media should be. You will be amazed.

#mastodonmigration #twittermigration #mastodontips

Twitter is proprietary software, also known as closed-source, that is owned by Elon Musk. We don‚Äôt know much detail in how Twitters algorithms work as only employees of Twitter have access to privileged parts. It‚Äôs their ‚Äúsecret sauce‚Äù much like the secret formula to Coca Cola.

#TwitterMigration #Mastodon #Twitter #MastodonMigration

I created a List of all journalists on Mastodon that can be easily imported into your account (.csv file).

content:
@wendysiegelman This is an important discussion. One of the hardest differences to get used to here is using #hashtags in most every post to facilitate #search where you want it. Hashtags are invitations to collaborate. Users get to define the searchable boundaries of their interactions. Something may be lost, but the net effect seems less aggressive, intrusive, and chaotic. It is certainly less stressful over here.

#twittermigration #mastodonmigration #research

content:
Mastodon is basically a federation of planets.

Each instance is its own solar system. Everyone that plays nice gets to interact across the fediverse.

When the Borg show up, everyone blocks them and they get banished to the delta quadrant.

#mastodonmigration #startrek #twittermigration #birdapp #mastodon #migration
___

If you're into Trek and this resonated, you should read my short thread on that time I worked with LeVar --> https://lawfedi.blue/@jonpainterphoto/

content:
OK. I deactivated two Twitter accounts. The first deletion was easy, it was for my visionary ecofiction publishing company and we mostly use our Facebook page anyway, so no big deal. The second was my personal account. At its peak the account had about 12,000 followers and many, many curated lists. I opened the account in 2011, my second go around with Twitter. You know what? I actually had to grieve for a moment before I let go the personal account. I guess it meant more to me to connect and to curate in that way than I had realized. But, on now having done it (ripping off the bandaid), it feels easy, natural and free. Onward!

#AccountMigration
#BandAid
#BreakUp
#Curation
#Deactivation
#FacebookPage
#Focus
#Lists
#MastodonMigration
#Onward
#SocialMedia

content:
Version 2.0 of the Fediverse Archive Browser has now been posted at the below link. It is available for Linux, Mac, and Windows desktops. This version adds support for the archive downloadable from your Mastodon site. It can also read Diaspora site archives and Friendica archives generated by the Friendica Archive Generator. Along with browsing your old content you can perform free text searching, date span searching, look at your posting metrics, and more. Released under an Mozilla Public License and written in Flutter. #fediverse #mastodon #friendica #diaspora #TwitterMigration #MastodonMigration #FediverseMigration #MPL #OpenSource #flutter

content:
I'm thinking about what I like on here, and what I disliked on the other site.

I'm not chasing the metrics, the boosts or likes, for me, there is a freedom here, it's closed, consent driven, slower paced, respectful, mindful and about sharing of thoughts and ideas.

The longer words means it can be like a blog post, not simply quickly jotting a thought and sending it out there.

Feels more community, and even if it isn't, that's how I'm choosing to engage.

I already see people I followed on the other site that stick out, are jarring on here.

I may be one of them, but hope not too much, and hope to adapt soon.

#mastodon #MastodonMigration #BirdSite

content:
A few things I've learned in my first few days here on Mastodon:

There is no algorithm to preferentially display posts.

Hashtags are super important.

If in doubt, use content warnings (CW).

All of the servers are interconnected, as well as other apps for videos and longer fb style posts. All part of the Fediverse.

Mastadon is not Twitter. It's better.

#TwitterMigration #MastodonMigration

content:
ADAPTATION PRACTICES & #MASTODONMIGRATION

Some of the things I'm keeping mindful of:

* Notice the tendency to view change as something that is done to another. A counter is to invest more energy into your own changes, & to not see yourself as an instigator but a participant in change.

* While there may be seemingly pervasive behaviours happening, your own micro practices are just as critical.

* Ride this opportunity to put energy into what you want to keep & let go of. Unlearning time...

#MastodonMigration 'veI finally migrated from mastodon.social (where I've been since 2018) to functional.cafe to free up space there and help it cope with the influx of newcomers.
Account migration is certainly doable, but I think there's a lot of room for improvement.
1. The "Handle of the new account" field description says "Specify the username@domain ...", but in reality requires @username@domain format and rejects handles without a leading "at" without explanation.
2. I see no reason why there can't be an option to also migrate follows, not only followers.
3. Worse yet, on the old instance, after migration I could only access the list of follows from my public profile page ¬≠‚Äî they were no longer accessible from the account page. If I chose to hide my social graph, I suppose I'd have to extract them from the personal data archive (if they are even there).
4. I discovered that I was "following" a few people whose instances were dead, but there's no indication of that in the UI.
I suppose it's time for bug reports.

content:
Interesting - I just took a look at my old #Mastodon profile, using another account where I follow it. It's not showing a redirect and the follow/unfollow button is still available.

But if I log in to that old account, it says it's redirecting, and that I have recently run a migration.

I guess this is down to the target server falling over, or the source server being overloaded when I initiated that migration. Presumably, if I try run it again in a month, that may fix it?

#MastodonMigration

content:
@mastodonusercount By end of next week (Friday 18th Nov 2022) the #Mastodon User Count might reach nearly 8 million users. Today (9th Nov 2022) it is 6.3 million.

In the plot, the blue curve is a simple two-parameter model, based on assuming users leave #Twitter at some daily #migration rate, and with the rate changing (accelerating) as #twexit awareness grows. It's a simple #TwitterMigration model, but it fits the available #MastodonMigration user count data quite well.

content:
#twittermigration #mastodonmigration
Very Cool Stuff!

Lists, Filters and Followed Hashtags

Three amazing easy things you can do with Mastodon!

Your Home feed shows posts from all the accounts you follow. With Lists you can construct other feeds comprising a subset of accounts you follow. With Filters you can hide posts containing keywords or phrases. With Followed Hashtags all posts containing a hashtag will added to your Home feed.

Cool Stuff Instruction Link >>> https://medium.com/@mastodonmigration/sharing-advice-and-assisting-with-the-great-mastodon-migration-53c1a286b805#03d4

content:
TIP OF THE DAY

If your instance server is having a hard time right now, don't freak out.

You do not need to change servers. Mastodon is getting a huge influx of new users and they are all working tirelessly to add capacity. If you are otherwise happy with your instance, trust that they will get things working smoothly. Give them some time to sort things out.

We're all in this together. It's our social network. Be patient. What we are building is amazing.

#mastodonmigration #twittermigration

content:
Followed Hashtags - Add all posts containing the hashtag to your Home feed.

# Explore >>> Enter #[Hashtag] in Search or paste URL >>> Enter >>> Click hashtag from list below >>> Click Follow hashtag icon (little man with a +) on the right

content:
Very Cool Stuff!

Lists, Filters and Followed Hashtags

Here are three amazing easy things you can do with Mastodon!

Your Home feed shows posts from all the accounts you follow. With Lists you can also construct other feeds comprising a subset of accounts you follow. With Filters you can hide posts containing keywords or phrases. With Followed Hashtags all posts containing a hashtag will also be shown in your Home feed.

#twittermigration #mastodonmigration

Hi, I'm Elbe Spurling, an atheist, artist, and author best known for having spent 12 years illustrating the entire Bible in LEGO bricks, from the Garden of Eden to the book of Revelation. The project spawned a very popular website (http://TheBrickBible.com), and book series.

content:
#twittermigration #mastodonmigration
Tip 1

Mastodon is many independent servers all working together. You join one server, but see postings from all the servers. It's one big social network, same as Twitter. For the bigger general servers that's the way to think about it. Just join any one of them, it doesn‚Äôt matter so long as they are well run and have sufficient capacity.

Mastodon Quick Start

content:
@mastodonmigration is updated periodically, according to the following process:

- Review and boost selected Mastodon comments containing #mastodonmigration #twittermigration #introduction hashtags
- Review and retweet selected Twitter comments containing #mastodonmigration #twittermigration #mastodon hashtags
- Promote good advice and migration related news
- Publish any original topical posts including traffic tracking.

So, go through the top advice and news, and scroll down for new users.

After a couple of days on #Mastodon I‚Äôm very impressed & excited to be part of this growing community! #mastodonmigration

content:
Kicking off today's #SocialCoop #tootup!

The #BuyTwitter vote is Monday and, despite the #twitter board's opposition to the resolution calling for an "exit to #democratic #UserOwnership", the campaign has gotten good traction and solid media attention.

Two questions:
1. Ideas for how to get the word out and boost the number of petition sigs on https://buytwitter.org/ by Monday?
2. How might the vote's aftermath be leveraged to trigger a #MastodonMigration?

#mastodon #meta #platformcoop
